data.title: anti-Semitic, adj. meanings, etymology and more

Factsheet

What does the adjective anti-Semitic mean?

There is one meaning in OED's entry for the adjective anti-Semitic. See ‘Meaning & use’ for definition, usage, and quotation evidence.

How common is the adjective anti-Semitic?

About 1occurrence per million words in modern written English

18500.000318600.000518700.01118800.04318900.07419000.1119100.1619200.3219300.7419400.9619501.119601.019701.019801.019901.120001.220101.3

How is the adjective anti-Semitic pronounced?

British English

an-tee-suh-MIT-ik

U.S. English

an-tigh-suh-MID-ik

/ˌæn(t)isəˈmɪdɪk/

an-tee-suh-MID-ik

Where does the adjective anti-Semitic come from?

The earliest known use of the adjective anti-Semitic is in the 1850s.

OED's earliest evidence for anti-Semitic is from 1851, in the writing of Thomas Carlyle, author, biographer, and historian.

anti-Semitic is formed within English, by derivation; partly modelled on a German lexical item.

Etymons: anti- prefix, Semitic adj.

Nearby entries

Etymology

Summary

Formed within English, by derivation; partly modelled on a German lexical item.

< anti- prefix + Semitic adj. (compare sense A.2b at that entry), in early use (e.g. in quots. 1879, 1881) frequently after German antisemitisch (1865). Compare earlier anti-Jewish adj.…

< anti- prefix + Semitic adj. (compare sense A.2b at that entry), in early use (e.g. in quots. 1879, 1881) frequently after German antisemitisch (1865). Compare earlier anti-Jewish adj.

Notes

Compare French antisémitique atypical of Semitic languages, cultures, or religions (1850 or earlier), anti-Jewish (1868 or earlier).

Meaning & use

Quotations

Hide all quotations

Contents

Characterized by prejudice, hostility, or discrimination towards Jewish people on religious, cultural, or ethnic grounds; anti-Jewish.

Quot. 1851 appears to show an isolated use with uncertain significance, and long precedes the continental European movement of the 1870s and later (compare etymology note at anti-Semitism n.).

It was not as a ghastly phantasm, choked in Thirty-nine-article controversies, or miserable Semitic, Anti-Semitic street-riots..that this man appeared in life.

T. Carlyle, Life of John Sterling i. i. 6

In the month of September last, a few Berliners..got up a club—the ‘Anti-Semitic’—for the purpose of provoking an agitation against the Jews.

New York Times 15 December 2/3

Anti-Semitic literature is very prosperous in Germany.

Athenæum 3 September 305/2

It is bitter for me to see him unctuously condemned from the side lines by politicians who I know are anti-Semitic but who feel it is impolite to say so... I have never heard him say anything derogatory about a Jew as such.

A. M. Lindbergh, Letter 17 September in War within & Without (1980) 227

Table 6 shows that documented anti-Semitic incidents throughout the United States have increased 70 percent in the last 10 years.

White Supremacist Activity in Montana (Montana Advisory Comm. to U.S. Commission on Human Rights) ix. 33/2

How should our community respond to the recent acts of anti-Semitic vandalism?

Herald-Times (Bloomington, Indiana) 9 December a6/4

Opposed or hostile to Jewish people or Judaism; anti-Semitic. Also: contrary to Jewish custom, teachings, etc.

Characterized by prejudice, hostility, or discrimination towards Jewish people, on religious, cultural, or ethnic grounds; anti-Jewish, anti-Semitic.

Characterized by prejudice, hostility, or discrimination towards Jewish people on religious, cultural, or ethnic grounds; anti-Jewish.

Characterized by prejudice, hostility, or discrimination towards Jewish people on religious, cultural, or ethnic grounds; anti-Semitic.

Forms

Variant forms

anti-Semitic, anti-semitic, antisemitic

Frequency

anti-Semitic typically occurs about once per million words in modern written English.

anti-Semitic is in frequency band 5, which contains words occurring between 1 and 10 times per million words in modern written English. More about OED's frequency bands

Frequency data is computed programmatically, and should be regarded as an estimate.

Frequency of anti-Semitic, adj., 1850–2010

* Occurrences per million words in written English

Historical frequency series are derived from Google Books Ngrams (version 2), a data set based on the Google Books corpus of several million books printed in English between 1500 and 2010.

The overall frequency for a given word is calculated by summing frequencies for the main form of the word, any plural or inflected forms, and any major spelling variations.

For sets of homographs (distinct entries that share the same word-form, e.g. mole, n.¹, mole, n.², mole, n.³, etc.), we have estimated the frequency of each homograph entry as a fraction of the total Ngrams frequency for the word-form. This may result in inaccuracies.

Smoothing has been applied to series for lower-frequency words, using a moving-average algorithm. This reduces short-term fluctuations, which may be produced by variability in the content of the Google Books corpus.

Decade Frequency per million words 18500.000318600.000518700.01118800.04318900.07419000.1119100.1619200.3219300.7419400.9619501.119601.019701.019801.019901.120001.220101.3

Frequency of anti-Semitic, adj., 2017–2023

* Occurrences per million words in written English

Modern frequency series are derived from a corpus of 20 billion words, covering the period from 2017 to the present. The corpus is mainly compiled from online news sources, and covers all major varieties of World English.

Smoothing has been applied to series for lower-frequency words, using a moving-average algorithm. This reduces short-term fluctuations, which may be produced by variability in the content of the corpus.

Entry history for anti-Semitic, adj.

Originally published as part of the entry for anti-Semitism, n.

anti-Semitic, adj. was revised in December 2019.

anti-Semitic, adj. was last modified in July 2023.

oed.com is a living text, updated every three months. Modifications may include:

further revisions to definitions, pronunciation, etymology, headwords, variant spellings, quotations, and dates;

Revisions and additions of this kind were last incorporated into anti-Semitic, adj. in July 2023.
